description: Part single and part two storey rear extension to provide additional storage space for ground floor A1 retail unit and bedroom at first floor level together with the change of use of the first floor from ancillary office to 1x bedroom residential flat
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Details of the design and location of on site refuse and recycling facilities and an accompanying management plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the first use of the development hereby approved. The approved arrangements shall be implemented prior to first use of the development hereby approved and permanently retained thereafter, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the local planning authority.   Reason: To ensure refuse and recycling storage and management arrangements are provided in order to ensure highway safety and promote recycling in the interests of sound environmental management, all in accordance with policies 2.10 and 9.1 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 - Refuse and Recycling Facilities. | The flat roof to be created shall not be used to form a balcony, roof garden or similar amenity area.  Reason: To safeguard the living conditions of the occupiers of the adjoining properties and visual appearance of the building, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of sound attenuation measures from traffic, aircraft and industrial noise together with associated ventilation for the proposed residential unit shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, Such details as approved shall be implemented prior to the first occupation of any of the residential units and thereafter permanently retained, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of future occupiers of the residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 10 - Noise and Vibration. | Before the first floor residential flat hereby approved is first occupied the developer shall enter into a section 106 legal agreement with the local planning authority to ensure that any future residents in the first floor residential flat in this development shall not be eligible to obtain residents' parking permits to park their vehicles in the Controlled Parking Zone.  Reason: In the interests of traffic safety, and to ensure that the surrounding streets are not subject to parking stress or danger or nuisance from inappropriate on-street parking or waiting as a result of the proposed development in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and the advice contained in the Council's adopted Supplementary Planning Document 3: 'Low Car Housing in Controlled Parking Zones'. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policy 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
